solution_line_template: We know he bought the same number of bananas as Arnold but that he bought {tony_apples_dozen}-{arnold_apples_dozen}={apples_dozen_difference} dozen apples more than Arnold
Therefore a dozen apples should cost ${tony_minus_arnold}

If Arnold paid ${arnold_paid} and ${cost_per_dozen_apples} for a dozen apples then the bunch of bananas cost ${arnold_paid}-${cost_per_dozen_apples}=$<<{arnold_paid}-{cost_per_dozen_apples}={cost_bananas}>>{cost_bananas}
